manzils.text: Qaf, (Allah swears) by the Glorious Qur´an
In fact, they are surprised because one of their own, (a mortal like themselves), came to them as a warner. The unbelievers said, "That is really odd
(Would we live again) after we die and become dust? Such a return (to life) is far-fetched, (a fantasy)
(Really)? We know very well everything that the earth consumes from their (dead decomposing) bodies. With Us is the book that (records and) preserves (every event)
No! In fact they rejected the truth (about the hereafter) just as soon as it came to them. So now they are perturbed and perplexed
(Isn´t life after death likely)? Did they not ever look at the sky above them? (Did they not wonder) how We made and adorned it? Lapses it does lack; it is free of flaws
And (what about) the earth? We laid out the earth, placed mountains firmly upon it, and caused all sorts of delightful plant life to proliferate on it
These are the (clues), insights and reminders for every human being, anyone turning (to Allah) in repentance
From the sky We sent down the water as (Our) blessing; and with it, We produced the gardens and the harvested grain
As also the tall date trees with their densely clustered dates
(Such is) the provision for My servants! With that water, We bring the dead land back to life. The emergence (of the dead back to life) shall happen in much the same manner
Prior to them, ( the present day unbelievers), the nation of Nooh, the people of ´Russ´, and ´Samood´ had rejected (life-after-death)
And ´Aads´, the pharaohs and the brethren of Loot
The people of ´Aikah´, and the nation of ´Tubbah´. Each of them rejected the messengers. So (My) threat became a reality
Were We not capable of bringing this creation into being the first time? Yet, they are uncertain about the new creation, ( the revival of creation)
Indeed, We have created man, and (so) We are surely aware of every thought that crosses his mind. We are closer to him than his jugular vein
(Remember)! The two sentries, (the two angels responsible for recording deeds), _ one sitting on the right (shoulder), the other on the left _ are receiving (and recording everything)
Not a word uttered by any person, escapes (the attention of) the vigilant observers _ (the angels assigned over him)
The agony (and stupor) of death will bring about the truth, "This is the very thing you used to avoid and evade
Then the trumpet shall sound, "This is the promised day _ (the day of reckoning)
Every soul will arrive accompanied by (two angels), a guard and a witness
You had certainly been unmindful of this! We have lifted the scales off your eyes. So, very sharp is your vision today
And his companion, (the escorting Angel) would declare, "This one under my custody (and his record of deeds) is ready
Hurl every stubborn unbeliever into hell
The one who forbade the good, the transgressor, the skeptic
The one who assigned a god (for worship), besides Allah. So toss him into the toughest of torment
His comrade, (the Shaitan) would submit, "Our Lord, I did not force him to transgress and rebel. He was wayward himself; quite far astray
(Allah) will say, "Refrain from quarrelling in My presence. I had certainly warned you in advance
The sentence rendered by Me shall not be reversed. I am not (at all) cruel to My servants
That day, We shall ask the hell, "Are you full?" It will reply, "Are there more
The paradise would move closer to the righteous; wouldn´t be far (at all)
This (is the coveted prize) you had been pledged! (It is) for all those who always turn to Allah in sincere repentance and (grudgingly) guard (their covenant with Allah)
(It is) for the one who feared (Allah), the most Merciful, the Unseen; (for the one who) returned to Him with a repentant heart
In peace (and bliss), enter the paradise! This is the day of eternity
There, they shall have anything they want; and yet We have more (for them)

Many nations have We destroyed (for their sins) prior to them _ nations that were stronger, (more developed) and mightier. They penetrated (and colonized many) other lands. But did they find any place to escape
Indeed, there is a lesson in it for anyone who possesses a heart (that feels); anyone who listens attentively and applies his mind
We have certainly created the heavens and the earth, and everything else between them, in six periods of time. And that did not wear Us out, the least bit
Have patience, and tolerate what they say. Chant the praises of your Lord (every day) before sunrise and before sunset
Also, chant His praises at night; and (glorify Him again) at the end of prostration (during each prayer)
Listen! The day the trumpeter calls from a nearby place
Is the day they shall hear the blast, the call of truth! That will be the day of release (from the graves)
Indeed, We (alone) bestow life, and We give death. Towards Us, is the return trip (of every soul)
That day, the earth will split open, allowing them to emerge (from their graves) in a hurry. (Carrying out) such (a feat of) gathering (of all souls) is quite easy for Us
We know quite well what they say. (You may not compel them), and you are not (appointed) a tyrant over them. With (the help of) this Qur´an. remind the one who fears (and heeds) My warning
(Allah swears) by the winds that scatter and disperse
And those that pick up a heavy load (of moisture)
Yet, glide through so easily
Then, they distribute and apportion (rain) per His command
That which you are promised, (the afterlife), is certainly the absolute truth
Indeed, the reckoning of deeds is just bound to occur
And (He swears) by the sky with orbits (of countless celestial bodies)
In fact, you (skeptics) hold (different and) diverse views (about life, death and after death)
Kept away (from the truth) is the one who has a hatred (for it)
Damned are those who conjecture
Immersed (in ignorance), they are preoccupied (by their preconceived ideas)
They ask, "When would that day of reckoning arrive
That day, they would be tormented by fire
(Here)! Taste (the outcome of) your misdeeds. This is (precisely) what you had so eagerly demanded to be hastened
(That day), those who fear (Allah) would be in (the blissful) gardens of paradise, amid springs
(Gratefully) accepting whatever (blessings) their Lord would grant them. Indeed, prior to this (in their life) they used to act righteously
They did not sleep much at night, but only a part of the time
And before dawn (late at night), they sought forgiveness (for their sins)
And (they accepted the fact that) the deprived and the destitute had a rightful share in their wealth
For those who have a firm faith, there are (convincing) signs on this earth
And even in your own selves. So then, do you not notice
In the sky is your sustenance; and that which you are being promised (the afterlife)
And (I swear) by the Lord of the heavens and the earth! It _ (the afterlife) _ is indeed an absolute reality! Just like the reality that you have the power of speech and diction
Has the story of the honored guests of Ibraheem reached you
When they came to him, they said, "Peace!" Ibraheem replied, "Peace!" Folks appear to be strangers
Then he went (inside the house) to his family, and brought back a fattened (roasted) calf
And placed it before them, then said, "Why don´t you eat
(They did not eat, and so) he felt afraid of them. They said, "Do not be afraid!" And they gave him the good news of a learned son
His wife came forward, slapped her forehead and exclaimed loudly, "(I am) old and barren
They said, "Despite that, precisely! Your Lord has said that He is the Wisest, the most Aware
(Ibraheem) said, "So what is your mission, oh you messengers
They said, "We have been sent towards a criminal nation, (the people of Loot)
To rain upon them stones of baked clay
Earmarked (especially) by your Lord for the transgressors
(But first) We evacuated from the town anyone who was a believer
There, We did not find more than a single house of the believers
In that town, We left behind (nothing except) signs for those who fear the painful punishment
And (We left signs) in (the saga of) Musa, when We sent him to the pharaoh with a distinct and definite authority
But the pharaoh relied on his might, and turned away (in arrogance); and said, "(He is) a magician, or (else he is) just plain mad
Therefore, We grabbed him and his armies and dumped them in the sea; he was damned
And (there are signs in the history of) the nation of ´Aads´, when We sent upon them the blighted lethal wind
It did not spare a thing. Whatever it touched, it (churned and) turned into dust and debris
In (the fate of) the people of ´Samood´, (there are signs)! They were told, "Enjoy yourself for just a while
They displayed contempt for the command of their Lord. So a bolt of lightning struck them, while they looked on (helplessly)
They could neither stand on their feet, nor help themselves
And prior to them, (We destroyed) the people of Nooh. They were indeed a rebellious sinful nation
With Our power and prowess, We brought into being the universe. And indeed, We expand it (steadily)
And We have spread out the earth. (Observe)! How aptly did We stretch it
We have created everything in pairs. Perhaps you would bear that in mind
(Say), "And (hurry), run towards Allah. I am really an obvious warner from Him to you
And do not assign a god (for worship), along with Allah! I´m really a clear warner from Him to you
Thus, the same was said about every messenger who came before them, "(He is) a magician! A lunatic
Do they leave this remark as a legacy (for future generations)? No! They are the defiant sinners, all of them
Turn away from them. You share no blame
But continue to remind them. Of course, the reminder (always) helps the believers
I have not created the jinn and the human kind, (for any reason) except that they should worship Me
I want no riches from them, and do not want them to feed Me
Indeed, the provider of sustenance (for all beings) is Allah, the One with absolute Power and matchless Might
Indeed! The evildoers of the present day shall have the same fate as those of their companions (in hellfire), the evil doers of the past. So, let them not ask Me to hasten (the Day of Judgment)
So, on that day of theirs, the promised day, there shall be (nothing but) misery for those who disbelieve
(Allah swears) by the mountain, Toor
And by the book inscribed
On fine parchment __ an open book, (the Qur´an), distributed (and found) all over
And (He swears) by the oft-visited house (of worship, the Kaaba in Makkah)
And the high (elevated) ceiling, (the sky)
And the surging sea
(He swears that) the punishment of your Lord shall definitely come to pass
Which absolutely no one can avert
The sky, that day, would rock and reel fiercely
Set in motion, the mountains will slide about briskly
There is misery that day for (all) those who denied (the revelation)
Those who stayed engrossed in (fruitless) pastimes
Pushed (and shoved) towards the hellfire (with disdain), they would be thrust into it with force
This is the fire you had refused to believe
(Now)! Is this magic, or don´t you see (clearly)
Burn in it! Bear it patiently, or be impatient. It is all the same for you, now! You are only being treated (strictly) in accordance with your deeds
And of course, those who feared (Allah) would be in paradise amidst blessings
Enjoying (with a relish) whatever their Lord will grant them. And their Lord will spare them the torment of the hellfire
Eat and drink, and enjoy (your reward for) what you used to do
They shall recline on thrones arranged in rows (as per their ranks). We will wed them with the lovely-eyed (heavenly) nymphs (of paradise)

(As a favor) for those who believe, We will make their offspring _ those who followed them in faith _ join them (in paradise). Not a bit shall be reduced from the reward of their deeds. Each person is held in a pledge _ (a guarantee) _ against the deeds he (or she) earns. (Good deeds alone meet the obligation)
And We shall continue to provide them such fruits and meats (in abundance), just as they please
Avidly, they shall take from each other cups of (exotic) wine (served) in paradise. It shall not cause a foolish flustered prattle, nor will it carry an offense
Dainty graceful lads would make the rounds, and wait on them. (Groomed and well-kempt) as if they were well preserved pearls
They would turn towards each other, and ask
They would say, "Earlier, living with our families, we passed our time being anxious and afraid
And Allah bestowed His favors upon us, and spared us the torment of the hot scorching wind
Indeed, (in our previous life), we used to invoke (and pray to) Him (exclusively). He is surely the Kind and the Merciful
So, (oh prophet), continue to admonish (them). By the grace of your Lord, you are not a (crystal gazing) soothsayer; and you are not a mad man
And they say, "(He is) a poet! Let us wait. An adverse turn of fortune may just do him in
Say, "Keep watching! I, too, shall watch with you
Is it (really) their intellect that instructs them (to say) this? Or are they a nation guilty of excess
Or do they say that he, (Muhammad, SAW), has composed the Qur´an himself? The fact is, they just don´t (want to) believe
If they are right, let them come up with a similar kind of composition
Did they come into being out of nothing, and without the Creator? Or were they (their own) creators
Is it they, who brought the heavens and the earth into being? The fact is they lack faith
Is it they, who possess the treasures of your Lord? Do they have a license to use those treasures with impunity
Do they have a ladder, (or a device), with which they eavesdrop and listen (to matters beyond human perception)? If so, let those who eavesdrop present a definite proof
Does He really have daughters, while you have sons
(Oh prophet), are you asking them for a fee, so they feel burdened by that liability
Or, do they have (an access to) the unseen, and are they writing it down
Or perhaps they intend to play a trick (to escape the consequences of their deeds). But those who disbelieve are going to be outwitted
Or do they have patrons (and deities) other than Allah? Exalted is Allah, far above those they associate with Him as partners
(Even) if they saw a part of the sky falling down, they would (merely) say, "(It is only) a heap of clouds
So leave them till they meet their day _ the day when they shall be struck the lightning bolts
That day, their tricks (and schemes) will not protect them a bit; nor would they receive any help
Indeed, prior to this _ (the hellfire) _ there are (also) other kinds of torments for the evildoers (in this world, and in their graves). But, most of them do not know
So wait patiently for your Lord´s decree. For, of course you are always under Our watchful eye! And sing the praises of your Lord when you wake up (in the morning)
And chant His praises in the night, too. And again when the stars (begin to) set
(Allah swears) by the star, as it sets
Your companion, (Muhammad, SAW), did not err, nor was he duped
For, he does not speak what he wishes
(Instead), it is the revelation sent to him
A mighty being has taught him
The one with strength, (the angel Gibra´eel) who manifested himself (in his true form)
At the highest horizon
He then, came closer and hovered
He was two bow-lengths away, or (even) less
Thus, he conveyed to the servant of Allah the revelation
(The prophet´s) mind did not refute what he saw
Would you then quarrel with him, concerning what he (actually) saw
And he, (Muhammad, SAW), certainly saw the angel (in his true form) another time, too
Near the farthest bound of the Lotus tree
Close by, is the abode of the (promised) paradise
The Lotus tree was veiled over by (the nameless splendor), that which covered it (entirely)
He (Muhammad, SAW) was not awe-struck, or aghast; nor did his eyes stray
He definitely saw one of the greatest signs of his Lord
Have you, (oh idolaters), considered (the reality of) ´Laat´ and ´Uzza´ _ (the false goddesses of Arabia)
And the third, the ´Manaat´ _ (the other false goddess)
(What)? the male offspring are for you, (humans) and for Him are the females
This is, of course, an unfair allocation

These are nothing but names that you and your forefathers have conjured up. Allah has not granted any sanction for it. Although guidance from their Lord has certainly come to them, yet they merely follow their (guesses and) hunches, or whatever their desires dictate
Should man have whatever he desires
But to Allah belongs the end, (the life-to-come), as well as the beginning, (the life of this world)
There are many angels in the heavens. But their intercessions would not help anyone a bit, unless Allah allows such specific mediation in favor of whomever He wills, and pleases
In fact, those who do not believe in the afterlife are actually the ones who give the angels the female names (and gender)
About this they definitely have no knowledge. They merely go by their assumptions, but when it comes to (the search for) the truth, the assumptions do not help a bit
So ignore the ones who turn away from Our reminder, and desire only the life of this world
That is the extent (and limit) of their knowledge! Indeed, your Lord knows best who has strayed from His path; and He also knows the rightly guided ones

To Allah belongs everything in the heavens and everything on earth. So that, He may punish rightfully and in accordance with their deeds, those who commit evil; and so that He may bestow the excellent rewards upon those who are righteous

If those who steer clear of the grave sins and the shameful vile deeds stumble and err, (let them remember that) Allah abounds in forgiveness. He knows you so well, ever since He created you and established you on earth, ever since you were but a germ in your mother´s belly. Therefore, do not profess purity and piety for yourself. Allah knows better the one who is pious
Did you see the one who turned away
Gave a little, then held back
Does he have the knowledge of the unseen? Can he perceive it
Does he not have any knowledge of what is (revealed) in the book of Musa
Or Ibraheem, who honored his pledge
That no one shall carry the burden of any other
That man deserves nothing, except for what he strives
That very soon, (the results of) his efforts shall become apparent
Then, he would be rewarded to the maximum extent
And that with your Lord is the conclusion (of the saga of life)
And He it is, Who makes you laugh and cry
And He it is, Who gives you death and life
And He it is, Who created (you in) pairs _ male and female
From the sperm as it is emitted
And resurrection (the birth into the afterlife) is (an obligation) upon Him
And it is He, Who grants (His provisions) in abundance, or just enough
And He is the Lord of (the star), Sirius
He destroyed the ´Aads´ of the former (era)
And the ´Samoods´! None (of the rebels) did He spare
And the nation of Nooh before them! Indeed they were wicked and wanton
And He it is, Who overturned the cities lying upside down _ (the cities of Sodom and Gomorrah)
That, which covered those cities, covered them completely
(Oh humans)! Which one of the (many) blessings of your Lord would you ignore
This (prophet) is a warner! Like the earlier warners
That day, which is destined to arrive _ (the day of resurrection) _ is approaching fast
Except Allah, no one can prevent its arrival
(Oh you who disbelieve)! Do you express amazement at this Qur´an
You laugh and do not cry
Haughtily, you hold your heads high
(Instead, you better bow down your head), fall prostrate before Allah and worship
The hour (of Judgment) draws closer. The moon split apart
When they see a clear sign, they turn away and say, "(It is) an enduring illusion
They rejected (the truth), and followed their own whims. All matters must come to conclusion (at the appointed time)
Surely, stories have come to them (from the past) with sufficient moral example to restrain them (from being arrogant)
profound wisdom (has come)! But little do warnings benefit them
(So, oh prophet), turn away from them! That day, the caller shall summon them towards an unpleasant and onerous thing
Their eyes agape in fear, they shall spring out of their graves as if they were a swarm of locusts scattered around
Rushing towards the caller, the unbelievers would say, "This is (going to be) a hard (long) day
Prior to them, the nation of Nooh had defied. They rejected Our servant, and said, "(He is) insane!" He was rebuked and repulsed
So Nooh called his Lord (saying), "I have been overcome. Send Your help
We threw open the gates of the sky, and poured down a deluge
We riddled the earth with springs. All that water sufficed to implement the preordained purpose
And We had Nooh board a ship built with planks and nails
Under Our watchful eye, it sailed. A reward for the one who was rejected
We have surely left the ark as a sign. Is anyone there to heed
(Notice) how (severe) was My punishment, and how (true) were My warnings
We have really made this Qur´an easy (to understand)! Is anyone there to heed
The people of ´Aads´ rejected. So (notice) How (severe) was My punishment and how (true) were My warnings
In fact, We hit them with violent winds, on a day of unrelenting ill luck
The winds wrested people away and knocked them around, as if they were hollowed out trunks of the date trees
See how (severe) was My punishment, and how (true) were My warnings
We have really made this Qur´an easy (to understand)! Is anyone there to heed
The (people of) Samood also rejected the warnings
And they said, "Must we follow (the advice of) a mortal being, (just) one man among us? If we did that, we would certainly go astray! (That is) sheer madness
Is the (divine) message revealed to him, (and no one else), out of all the rest of us? No, rather he is a liar with delusions of self grandeur
(The messenger replied), "Tomorrow, you would find out for sure, who is the liar and who has delusions
(We told Our messenger), "We shall send a camel to serve as a test for them. So (just) observe and put up with them patiently
And tell them that the water supply would have to be shared. It would be by turns between them (and the camel). They would (have to) approach (the site of) water only at the schedule time
Instead, they summoned their comrade who (accepted the assignment and) butchered (the camel)
And (observe) how (severe) was My punishment, and how (true) were My warnings
We hit them with (just) a single blast, and suddenly they were like dried up straw sticking out of a mud wall
We have really made this Qur´an easy (to understand). Is anyone there to heed
The nation of Loot disregarded the warning
We hit them with a hurricane (of rocks and stones). But We rescued the family of Loot in the early hours of the morning
As a blessing from Us! This is how We reward the grateful ones
Loot had definitely, (and specifically), warned them of Our gruesome Might. But they remained skeptical of Our warnings
They attempted to seduce his guests, but We blinded their eyes. "Here! Experience a taste of My torment and My warning
And early in the morning, a lasting torment had certainly come to settle on them
Experience a taste of My torment and My warning
We have really made this Qur´an easy (to understand). Is anyone there to heed
Indeed, warnings had also come to the pharaoh and his people
They rejected all Our signs. So We took them to task. We clutched them with a masterful grasp of the Mighty, the most Proficient
Are your (present day) unbelievers in any way better than those ones (in the past)? Or have you been granted immunity by the scriptures
Do they say, "We are a (well knit) group bound to prevail
Soon every group would be routed and would turn their backs (to flee)
The fact is that the hour (of Judgment) is their appointed date (with disaster). That hour is far more ruinous and wrenching, a lot more (biting and) bitter
Indeed the criminals are (lost) in error, and are (engrossed) in a frenzied state (of denying the truth)
That day, fallen flat on their faces, the criminals would be dragged into the blaze. "Here! Taste a touch of hell
Indeed, We have created every single thing in appropriate proportions (with a plan and a purpose)
Our command (and its execution) is just one, (a single event). It comes about in a flash of an eye
We have certainly destroyed many like you. So, is anyone there to heed
Whatever they do is (recorded) in their book (of deeds)
Every single matter, big or small, is committed to writing
The pious would certainly be (living) in paradise amidst its rivers
Occupying the seats of sincerity (and honor) in the presence of the Mightiest Sovereign
(Allah), the most Merciful
Taught the Qur´an
He created man
And taught him speech
The sun and the moon function (perfectly), as per their schedules
From a blade of grass to a tree, (everything) prostrates (before Allah)
He raised the sky far above, and set up a (perfect) balance
So do not transcend the balance
Administer the weight (and measure) with justice. Do not inflict a loss to others (by cheating) at the scales
And He prepared the earth for (His) created beings
It has (all sorts of) fruits, (like) the sheathed clusters of dates
Corn with leafy stalks, and aromatic plants
So, which ones of the favors of your Lord won´t you acknowledge? (For how long)
He created the human kind out of dried mud, like a potter´s clay
He created the (race of) jinn out of the (lucent) blaze of fire
So which ones of the wonders of your Lord would you disregard? (For how long)
The Lord of the two Easts! And the Lord of the two Wests
So, which of the powers and prowess of your Lord will you refuse to heed? (For how long)
He brought the two seas (of sweet and salt water) closer _ close enough to mingle
Yet, there exists a barrier between them, which they do not overrun
So which one of the wonders of your Lord would you disregard? (For how long)
Pearls and corals (are mined and) emerge from each (of the two seas)
So which one of the favors of your Lord won´t you acknowledge? (For how long)
His are the ships that sail across the ocean, as if they were (the floating) mountains
So, which one of the wonders of your Lord would you disregard? (For how long)
Every being upon the earth is mortal, (and will die)
The only One to last and live on is your Lord _ the Lord of sublime glory and honor
So which one of the power and glory of your Lord would you refuse to heed? (For how long)
Every being in the heavens and on earth entreats (and relies upon) Him (for sustenance, survival and other needs). Every single day, He assumes yet another (wondrous state of) glory
So which one of the wonders of your Lord would you disregard? (For how long)
For you, the two sin laden groups, (one of men, the other of jinn), We would soon devote Ourselves (exclusively to judge you)
So which one of the power and might of your Lord would you refuse to heed? (For how long)
Oh you, the species of jinn and humans, if (you think) you possess the means to break free from the confines of the heavens and the earth, then do so. But, you shall not, without (His) sanction
So, which of the power and prowess of your Lord would you refuse to heed? (For how long)
Blazing (fiery) fireballs, and (flaming molten) brass would be let loose upon you. Escape you shall not
So, which of the power and might of your Lord would you refuse to heed? (For how long)
And then the sky shall split asunder and turn red, just like (freshly tanned) leather
So, which one of the wonders of your Lord would you disregard? (For how long)
That day, neither humans nor jinn would (need to) be questioned concerning their sins
So, which of the power and prowess of your Lord would you refuse to heed? (For how long)
The criminals would be easily identified by their distinctive marks and mien. They would be grabbed by the lock of their hair, and their feet
So which of the power and might of your Lord would you refuse to heed? (For how long)
Here is the hell that criminals had refused to believe
To and fro, they would rotate between it and the (fiercely) hot water
So which of the power and might of your Lord would you refuse to heed? (For how long)
A twin garden (in paradise) exists (as a reward) for the one who dreads to stand before his Lord, (and His reckoning)
So, which one of the favors of your Lord won´t you acknowledge? (For how long)
With diverse wondrous things (in each)
So which one of the favors of your Lord won´t you acknowledge? (For how long)
With a couple of springs streaming across each (garden)
So which one of the favors of your Lord won´t you acknowledge? (For how long)
With two varieties of each type of fruit in each (garden)
So which one of the favors of your Lord won´t you acknowledge? (For how long)
(The righteous) would recline on (exotic) carpets lined with lush brocade. (Loaded with plentiful fruit), the branches of fruit trees would hang low, within easy reach
So which one of the favors of your Lord won´t you acknowledge? (For how long)
In these (gardens of paradise), the righteous shall have mates that are chaste-eyed and demure _ not deflowered by any human or jinn before them
So which one of the favors of your Lord won´t you acknowledge? (For how long)
(So very lovely), as if they were rubies and pearls
So which one of the favors of your Lord won´t you acknowledge? (For how long)
Do excellent deeds deserve anything except the most excellent rewards
So which one of the favors of your Lord won´t you acknowledge? (For how long)
In addition to the two (already promised), they shall have two more gardens
So which one of the favors of your Lord won´t you acknowledge? (For how long)
(With foliage) of the deepest green color
So which one of the favors of your Lord won´t you acknowledge? (For how long)
With two (constantly) gushing fountains in each (garden)
So which one of the favors of your Lord won´t you acknowledge? (For how long)
Each with (plenty of) fruits _ dates and pomegranates
So which one of the favors of your Lord won´t you acknowledge? (For how long)
There, they shall have beautiful virtuous (wives)
So which one of the favors of your Lord won´t you acknowledge? (For how long)
Lovely eyed (heavenly) nymphs (of paradise) lodged in pavilions
So which one of the favors of your Lord won´t you acknowledge? (For how long)
Whom no human or jinn had deflowered
So which one of the favors of your Lord won´t you acknowledge? (For how long)
The righteous shall recline on lush green cushion, and exquisite (exotic) carpet
So which one of the favors of your Lord won´t you acknowledge? (For how long)
Hallowed is the name of your Lord, the Lord of Might and Majesty
When that (inevitable) event, (the Day of Judgment) occurs
There shall be no one to deny the fact of its occurrence
(It will) humble some, honor others
When the earth shall be shaken up violently
And the mountains are ground up into fine particles
And scattered about as dust
(That day), you shall (all) be (divided into) three factions
The people of the right! How (fortunate) would be the people of the right
The people of the left! How (wretched) would be the people of the left
(But of course), the foremost (in righteousness, those who exceeded and excelled) would be the foremost (in honor)
They would be nearest (to Allah)
In the blissful paradise
Many (of the foremost would be) from the earlier (generations)
And fewer from the later (generations)
(They will sit) on thrones engraved with gold and precious stones
They would recline (on their thrones), facing each other
Youthful lads, who would stay young forever,would wait on them
With cups and goblets, and glasses filled (with pure wine) from the spring
It would neither cause a hangover, nor affect their senses
And (they shall have) fruits, any (kind) they choose
And the flesh of birds and fowl, whichever they fancy
And lovely-eyed nymphs (of paradise)
(So beautiful), as if they were pearls preserved in their shells
(All as) rewards for what they used to do
There, they shall not hear anything vulgar or vile
Only serene and peaceful greetings
And for the people of the right? How (fortunate) would be the people of the right
(They would be in a place) with thornless lotus trees
Clusters of Acacia _ (a tree in paradise)
Dense and defuse shade
Water pouring out (of springs constantly)
Plenty of fruits
Unforbidden and limitless
And elevated thrones
(As for their wives), We would fashion them afresh
And make them young again, vernal and virginal
Loving and devoted mates of the same age
(All this), for the people of the right
(There would be) many (of them) from the earlier (generations)
And many from the later (generations)
And the people of the left? How (wretched) would be the people of the left
(They would live) in the (blistering) hot wind, and the (boiling) hot water
Under the cover of the dark smoke
Which is neither cool nor refreshing
Prior to this, they had the life of leisure and luxury
And persisted in the greatest of sins
They used to say, "After we die and wither away into dust and bones, would we really be brought back to life
And our forefathers, too
(Tell them, oh prophet) "Indeed, all (of you) of the earlier and later times
Would certainly be gathered together at the selected place, on an appointed day
And then, oh you who went astray and rejected (the truth)
You would certainly have to eat the fruit of the tree of ´zaqqum´
And stuff yourself with it
(To flush it down), you are going to have (only) hot boiling water
Which you will drink like a thirst stricken camel
Such will be their ´reception´ on the Day of Judgment
It is We Who has created you. Why then do you not affirm the truth
Do you ever think about the semen you ejaculate
Do you turn it into a human fetus, or are We the Creator
We have decreed death for all of you, and We are not incapable
Of altering your form, and reshaping you into an altogether different existence. An existence about which you know absolutely nothing
You are certainly well aware of this (present) form of creation. So, why do you not heed
Do you ever think about the seeds you sow in the soil
Do you make them grow? Or is it We Who turns the seeds into a field full of crops
If We wish, We can convert the crop into chaff and leave you whining
(Saying), "We have really been penalized
In fact we have been deprived
Do you ever think about the water you drink
Did you bring it down from the rain clouds? Or is it We Who makes the rain come down
If We wish, We could make it brackish. So why aren´t you grateful
Do you ever think about the fire you build (from logs)
Did you bring the trees (and forests) into being? Or is it We Who causes them to be
We have made all this to remind you (of Us), and a skill (providing comfort) for those in the wilderness
So glorify and praise the name of your Supreme Lord
No, of course not! I swear by the position of the stars
And it is, indeed, a very solemn oath if you only knew
(I swear that) this (Qur´an) is certainly a noble recital
(Inscribed) in a well-guarded book
Only those who are (physically and ritually) clean, (are allowed to) touch it
(It is) a revelation from the Lord of the universe
Yet, do you shun this narrative (nonchalantly)
Do you make the denial (of the truth) your livelihood, (and respond to the blessings by rejecting the truth)
How about when (the soul of the dying) heaves up into the throat
At that time, you can do nothing but look on (helplessly)
Compared to you, We are closer to the one dying. But you cannot see
Thus, if (you think) you are not subject to reckoning, why can´t you
Return the soul back (to the dead), if you are (indeed) truthful
And if the dying person had been (the one) nearest (to Allah)
(He shall have) peace and tranquility, bounteous provisions and the blissful idyllic paradise
While if the (dying) person is among those of the right (side)
(He shall hear the greetings), "Peace be to you. (You are) among those of the right (side)
But if the deceased happens to be among those who rejected and went astray
(He shall have) the hot boiling water ´to welcome´ him
And the roasting heat of the hellfire
Indeed! That is definitely and most certainly the absolute truth
So, (oh prophet)! glorify and praise the name of the Greatest, your Supreme Lord
Whatever is in the heavens and on earth, glorifies and praises Allah. He is the Mightiest, the Wisest
The kingdom of the heavens and the earth belongs to Him. He gives life and death, and He is capable of doing everything
He is the First and the Last, the Perceptible and the Unseen. And He is well Aware of every single thing

He is the One Who created the heavens and the earth in six periods of time, then mounted the throne. He knows whatever enters the earth and whatever comes out of it, whatever comes down from heavens and whatever ascends up to it. He stays with you no matter where you happen to be. Allah watches over everything you do
The kingdom of the heavens and the earth belongs to Him. All matters are referred to Allah (for decision)
He causes the night to settle over the day, and He causes the day to rise over the night. And He is fully Aware of everything, (even the innermost thoughts) that exists in the heart
Believe in Allah and His messenger and spend out of the wealth He has entrusted (in your care). There is a great reward for those of you who believe, and spend for His sake
What´s with you? Why do you not believe in Allah? The messenger urges you to believe in your Lord; and He has already secured a pledge from you, if you really are the believers

He it is Who revealed to His servant the clear proofs, (the explicit verses of the Qur´an), in order to bring you out of darkness into light. In fact, Allah is really very Merciful and very Kind to you

What is the matter with you? Why do you not spend for the sake of Allah? The heritage of the heavens and the earth belongs to Allah! Those of you who spent and fought for the sake of Allah prior to victory (at Makkah), are not equal to others. They are far more exalted in status than those who spent and fought after (victory). Yet, Allah has promised excellent rewards to both. Allah is well Aware of what you do
Is there anyone who would advance Allah a good (high yielding) loan. He will increase it manifold and return it to you. (In addition), there is a great reward (for the lender)

That day, you will see that the light (emanating) from the believing men and women would run in front of, and to the right of them. (They would hear), "There is good news for you, to day!" (They shall have) the paradise _ rivers run right through it _ and they shall live there forever. That, in fact, is the greatest triumph

That day, the hypocrite men and women would say to the believers, "Look at us and let us borrow (and avail) a little of your light." (But) they would be told, "Turn back! Go find your own light!" Thereupon, a wall would be set in place between them and the believers. The gate (in the wall) would lock in (the believers and) the mercy and grace (of Allah) on the inside. While on the outside (of the enclosure) would be nothing but torture

They would call the believers (saying), "Were we not with you (in the life of this world)?" The believers would reply, "Of course, but you let yourself be tempted. You waited, (hesitated), and entertained doubts. Your hopes and expectations deceived (and lulled) you, until the decree arrived from Allah. The master deceiver, (the Shaitan), deceived you about Allah
And today, no ransom would be accepted from you or from those who had disbelieved. Fire is your _ and your companion´s _ abode. It is an evil end of the journey

Is it not time yet, that the hearts of the believers should stir with the mention of Allah, and the absolute truth that has come to them? Do not be like those who were given the scriptures earlier. After the passage of a long time, their hearts became hardened. Today, most of them are evildoers
You should know that Allah gives life back to the land after its death. We have already explained the signs to you. Perhaps you would understand
Indeed, there is a generous reward for the men and women who give charity, and advance a virtuous loan to Allah. He will increase it manifolds (and give them due credit)

The really honest and upright are those who believe in Allah and His messengers. According to Allah, they are the (true) witnesses. They shall have the reward and the light. While those who refute and reject Our signs are going to be the people of hell

You should know that the life of this world is (nothing but) fun and games _ merely play and pastime. (It consists of) the bragging and boasting among you about the adornments and embellishments (of your existence), and the abundance of your wealth and children. It is just like the shower of rain, which causes lush green (fields) that please the tillers. (But) later on, it dries up and you see it turn pale and become chaff. In the life-to-come, there is severe punishment (for the unbelievers), and forgiveness from Allah and His acceptance (for the believers). The life of this world is (nothing but) an illusive deception _ a brief enjoyment

Rush towards forgiveness of your Lord and the paradise (He has promised). Its expanse is like the vastness of the sky and the earth; and it has been prepared for those who believe in Allah and His messengers. That is the grace of Allah. He confers it upon whomever He wants! Allah is the Lord of great honor
No calamity (ever) strikes the earth _ or you _ that is not (already written) in the book of decrees. (Written) much earlier, before We cause the calamity to come about. That is really easy for Allah

So that you would not feel morose (and mournful) over matters that elude you. (And so that) you would not exult (and gloat) over what He grants you. (Indeed), Allah does not like the arrogant braggart
Those who are stingy, and advise others to be stingy! (Now), should anyone turn back (remember), Allah is Free of all want and Worthy of all praise

We have certainly sent Our messengers with clear proofs. We revealed to them the scriptures and the criteria (to distinguish the right from wrong), so that you may establish justice. We revealed iron (to mankind). It has considerable might and many uses for mankind. (So that) Allah may know who helps Him and His messengers without having seen (Him). Indeed, Allah is (very) Strong and Powerful
We sent Nooh and Ibraheem (as messengers), and We established the prophethood and the scriptures among their descendants. (Some) among them are rightly guided, but most of them are evildoers

Then, We had many messengers follow in their footsteps _ one after another. (Eventually), We sent , the son of Mary and gave him the Gospel. We instilled compassion and mercy in the hearts of those who followed him. (As for) the monasticism, We did not impose it on them. They invented it themselves. (By such means), they sought the acceptance and the pleasure of Allah. Yet, they did not abide by the demands of monasticism. We granted the reward to those of them who believed. Most of them, (however), are evildoers

Oh you who believe! Fear Allah and have faith in His messenger. He will grant you twice (the portion of) His mercy. He will grant you light by which you shall walk (along the straight path)! And He will grant you forgiveness! Indeed, Allah is oft-Forgiving, the most Merciful

So the people of the book may know that they do not have any control (or exclusive right) over (the distribution of) Allah´s bounties. In fact, the bounties rest in the hands of Allah, and He confers them upon whomever He wishes. Allah is the Lord of the highest honor

(Oh prophet)! Allah has certainly heard the remarks of the woman who pleaded with you concerning her husband, and directed her complaint towards Allah. And Allah has heard the discussions the two of you had. Indeed, Allah hears all and sees all

Those who (swear and) declare their wives to be like their mothers (should know that) their wives are not their mothers. Of course, their mothers can only be those who gave them birth. What they utter is certainly condemned, and a lie. Allah is indeed the most Forgiving, the most Merciful

Those who declare their wives to be like their mothers, and later wish to rescind their statement must free a slave before they may approach their wives. You are being cautioned against (making such statements). Allah is well Aware of what you do

And the one who does not find (the resources to free a slave), must observe fasts daily for two consecutive months before the couple may touch each other. He who lacks the ability to fast should feed sixty poor people. This is so you may have faith in Allah and His messenger! These are the limits set by Allah. For the unbelievers there is a painful punishment

Indeed, those who oppose Allah and His messenger are going to be disgraced, just like those before them (who opposed Allah). We have revealed clear proofs! There is a disgraceful punishment for the unbelievers
That day Allah will resurrect them all, and He will tell them everything they had done. Allah has recorded everything, while they have forgotten. Allah is the witness to every single thing

Do you not realize that Allah knows everything in the heavens and on earth? Never is there a secret conference of three, where He is not the fourth (listening in); nor of five, where He is not the sixth (listening). Even when there are less (than three) or more than that number (holding secret talks), He is (always) with them no matter where they might happen to be. Later, on the Day of Judgment, He will tell them everything they had done! Indeed, Allah knows every single thing

Have you not seen those who were forbidden from engaging in intrigues and cabals? Yet they went back to doing (exactly) what they were forbidden (to do). They conspired to commit sins and wrongful acts, and to disobey the messenger. When they visit you, they greet you in a manner in which Allah did not greet you. (Mischievously, they twist words, as they salute you). In their hearts they say, "Why does Allah not punish us for what we say?" For them, hellfire is enough! They shall burn in it! What a despicable destination

Oh those of you who believe, do not hold secret talks for the sake of committing sins and wrongful acts, and for the sake of disobeying the messenger. Rather, if you hold secret talks, let it be for (the sake of) piety and righteousness; and (above all) fear Allah, before Whom you would all be gathered

Indeed, (these) secret (esoteric) communions are the work of the devil, (whose purpose is) to dishearten the believers. (But) without the sanction (and approval) of Allah, he cannot cause a bit of harm. The believers should place their trust in Allah (exclusively)

Oh those of you who believe! Make room (for others) in the gatherings when you are asked to do so. Allah will make room for you (in the life-to-come). Get up when you are asked to rise. (In the hereafter) Allah will raise the ranks of those of you who believe, and those granted the knowledge. Allah is well-Aware of what you do

Oh those of you who believe, whenever you seek a private audience with the messenger, present something in charity (to the poor) prior to the consultation. This is better for you _ and purer. (Yet) if you are unable (to offer charity), then Allah is the most Forgiving and the most Kind

Are you afraid of giving charity prior to your consultation with the messenger? So you may not _ and Allah forgives you for it _ (but) establish ´salat´, pay the ´zakat´ and obey Allah and His messenger. Allah is (well) Aware of what you do

Do you not see the hypocrites? They befriend the nation that has invoked the wrath of Allah. They _ (such hypocrites) _ neither belong to you nor to others (your enemies). They knowingly swear to their falsehood
Allah has prepared a severe punishment for them! Indeed, what they do is really evil
They use their oaths as their shields, and they prevent people from the path of Allah. A disgraceful punishment is (in store) for them
Their wealth and their children will not help them a bit against Allah! They are the people of the fire, and in it they shall stay forever

On that day, Allah will raise them all (back to life), and they will swear before Him just like they swear before you (now). They will fancy that their oaths will bring them some benefits. Beware! They are certainly the liars
Shaitan has gained mastery over them, and has caused them to become oblivious of the remembrance of Allah. They are the gang of Shaitan. Beware! The gang of Shaitan is definitely the loser
Indeed, those who oppose Allah and His Messenger are the ones who would be the lowest and the most humiliated
Allah has decreed, "I and My messengers shall certainly prevail!" Allah is the Strongest, and the most Powerful

You will never see it happen, that folks who believe in Allah and the Day of Judgment (also) love those who oppose Allah and His messenger, even if they happen to be their fathers, sons, brothers or other relatives. Such are the believers upon whose hearts Allah has etched faith; He has bolstered their belief with His true guidance and light. He will usher them into paradise, right through which, run rivers. They will live there forever! Allah is pleased with them and they are pleased with Him. They are the party of Allah! Beware, it is (really) the party of Allah that will triumph
Everything in the heavens and the earth chants the praises of Allah! He is the most Powerful and the Wisest

It is He Who drove the disbelievers, the people of the book, from their homes at the very start of assembly (the siege against them). You never thought they would depart (without resistance). And they thought their strongholds would defend them against Allah. But Allah came upon them from where they least expected. He cast terror in their hearts, so they ruined their homes with their own hands, and the hands of the believers. So learn the lesson, Oh you, endowed with sights
Had Allah not decreed (the life of) exile for them, He would certainly have punished them in this world. The punishment by fire is (in store) for them in the afterlife
This is so, because they acted in defiance of Allah and His messenger. Whoever goes against (the will of) Allah (should know that) Allah is indeed very Severe in reprisal
It was with Allah´s permission that you cut down (some of) the date palm trees and left (others) standing on their stems, in order that He might disgrace the evildoers

Allah granted their possessions to His messenger, as spoils (of war). You did not throw your horses and your camels (in battle) against them. Allah gives dominance to His messenger over whatever He pleases. Allah is capable of (doing) everything

The booty Allah granted to His messenger from the people of the town is for (the sake of) Allah, His messenger, the relatives (of the messenger), the orphans, the poor (and the needy), and the wayfarers; so that wealth may not get (hoarded) amongst your well to do. Accept what the Messenger grants you and stay away from what he forbids! Fear Allah. Indeed, Allah is very Severe in reprisal

(The booties are) for the poor immigrants who were driven out of their homes and (deprived of) their belongings, those who seek the bounties of Allah and His pleasures. They help (the cause of) Allah and His messenger! Such are truly the faithful ones

And the booties are for those who had houses (in the city) and had accepted the faith before others. (Because) they really love the immigrants who were driven out of their homes and came to them (for help). They do not entertain any greed in their hearts for what others have been given. They prefer others over themselves, even though they are poor. Those who escape the greed within their own hearts, are really the successful ones

Those who followed them (in faith) say, "Our Lord! Grant us forgiveness and also (grant forgiveness) to our brothers who preceded us in faith. Do not put hatred in our hearts for the believers. Our Lord, you are certainly the most Forgiving and the most Kind

Did you not observe the hypocrites? They say to their disbelieving friends, the people of the scriptures, "If you are banished (from town), then we too shall depart with you. We will never listen to anyone against you. We will come to your aid if war is waged upon you." Allah bears witness that they are surely the liars

Very definitely! If they, (the people of the book), are banished, the hypocrites will not depart with them. If they, (the people of the book), are attacked, the hypocrites will not come to their aid. They (the hypocrites) will turn their backs (and desert their allies), if they (at all) come to their aid. No help shall they receive, then
Indeed, in their hearts they fear you much more than they fear Allah. This is so because they are a nation that does not comprehend

They will not unite to fight you as a single force, except in fortified villages or from behind walls. Their enmity and aversion for each other is intense. You consider them united, but their hearts are divided! This is so because they are a nation that does not understand
They are (exactly) like their immediate predecessors who tasted the evil result of their conduct. A painful punishment is (in store) for them

(The hypocrites are) like Shaitan! He suggests to man, "Refute the truth! (be ungrateful)!" But as soon as man denies the truth, (Shaitan) says, "I am absolved of your sins! Indeed, I fear Allah, the Lord of the universe

The final outcome would be: both of them _ (Shaitan the enticer, and the man accepting his suggestion) _ would be (thrown) in the fire. Both would live there forever! And that is the befitting treatment for the evildoers
Oh you who believe, fear Allah! Each one should take stock! What (kind of deeds) has he sent forth for tomorrow, (the Day of Judgment)? Fear Allah! Indeed, He is well Aware of what you do
Do not be like those who forgot Allah, and (so) He made them forget their own selves. Such indeed are the disobedient ones
The companions of fire and the dwellers of paradise are not equal. It is the dwellers of paradise, who are certainly the successful ones

Had We sent this Qur´an upon a mountain, you would have surely seen it humbled _ burst asunder and trembling with the fear of Allah. These are (but) examples We quote for (the benefit of) mankind. Perhaps they would ponder
He is Allah! There is no god except Him, the Knower of the unseen and the manifest! He is the most Beneficent and the most Merciful

He is Allah! There is no god except Him, the King, the most Holy, the Grantor of peace, the Grantor of all security, the Majestic, the Compeller, and the ever Supreme! Exalted is Allah! Far above the partners they associate with Him

He is Allah, the Creator, the Ultimate Inventor, and the Grantor of shapes and forms. The best of all names belong to Him! Everything in the heavens and on earth chants His praises! He is the Almighty and the Wisest

Oh those of you who believe, if you (really) left your homes for Me, seeking My approval, then do not accept My enemies _ and your enemies _ as friends! You show them affection, even though they have rejected the truth that came to you! They exiled the messenger _ and you, too _ because you believe in Allah, your Lord. You secretly show them affection! I know what you conceal and what you declare! Whoever amongst you does that, has really left the straight path and has gone astray

They would treat you as their enemies, if they were to gain an upper hand over you. With evil (intent) they would assault you with their hands and their tongues. They (just) love to have you disbelieve (and renounce your faith)
Your relatives and your children will not benefit you on the Day of Judgment; He will judge (all matters) between you. Allah watches everything you do

There has been an excellent example for you in Ibraheem, and those with him. They said to their people, "(We hereby declare that) we are free of all guilt concerning you, and the gods you worship other than Allah. We renounce you (and your faith). There has appeared between us hatred, and hostility forever, until you come to believe in Allah (exclusively)." Ibraheem´s remarks to his father was an exception. (He had said), "I will seek forgiveness for you from Allah. (But) I lack the authority to get anything (at all) for you from Allah." (Ibraheem turned to Allah and said), "Our Lord! Upon You we rely and towards You we turn in repentance! Towards You is our journey back
Our Lord, do not turn us into a test for the unbelievers, and forgive us our Lord! Indeed, You _ and only You _ are the Almighty, the Wisest

In them _ (Ibraheem and those with him) _ there is certainly an excellent example to follow for anyone looking forward to (the meeting with) Allah on the Last Day. And should anyone turn away, Allah is certainly Free of all want and Worthy of all praise
Perhaps Allah will (once again) cast friendship and love between you and them _ those you have alienated. Allah has power over all things! Allah is the most Forgiving and the most Merciful

Allah does not forbid you to be just and righteous towards those who did not go into battle against you (over matters of faith), and did not expel you from your homes. Deal with them justly. Allah loves those who are just

But Allah forbids you to befriend those who fought against you over matters of faith, those who either assisted others in driving you out of your homes or drove you out themselves. Those of you who befriend them are indeed the evil doers

Oh those of you who believe, investigate (all) immigrant women who come to you, claiming to be the believers. Allah knows better, whether or not they believe. If you determine that they (really) are the believers, then do not repatriate them back to their non-believing husbands (or family). The believing women are not lawful for the non-believing men; nor are the non-believing men lawful for the believing women. Return to their non-believing husbands whatever they had spent (as nuptial dowry). You would not be committing a sin, if you marry such women, provided you pay them their due. Do not keep the non-believing women married to you. Ask them to return what you had spent upon them (as nuptial dowry). Let the non-believing husbands (likewise) receive the amounts they had spent on their (believing) wives. This is the command of Allah! He judges between you; Allah is the all-Knowing, the Wisest

(Even) if any of your wives leaves you for the disbeliever (without returning the nuptial dowry) still in your turn, pay the disbelievers whose wives leave them for you (an amount) equal to what they had spent. (Always) fear Allah, in Whom you (profess to) believe

Oh prophet! Accept the pledges of the believing women, when they come to take their oaths of allegiance to you. Provided, they pledge that they would not join any partners with Allah, would not steal, commit adultery or kill their children, and would not indulge in slander, and would not concoct lies on their own. Also, that they would not disobey you in what is right. Seek forgiveness for them from Allah! Certainly Allah is the most Forgiving and the most Merciful
Oh you who believe! Do not befriend the people who have incurred the wrath of Allah. Just like the disbelievers lying in their graves, they too have abandoned all hope about the afterlife
Everything in the heavens and on earth chants His praises; He is the Mightiest, the Wisest
Oh you who believe, why do you say that which you do not (intend to) do
It is greatly despised by Allah that you should say something, and then not do it
Indeed, Allah loves those who fight in His path, organized and arrayed as if they were a single solid structure

(Remember), when Musa said to his people, "Oh my people, why do you annoy and irritate me? You already know that I am really the messenger of Allah for you!" (But) when they deviated (from the truth), Allah made their hearts turn further away (from the truth). Allah does not guide the sinful people

And (remember) when Jesus son of Mary said, "Oh children of Israel, I have really been appointed the messenger of Allah towards you. I confirm the Torah, the scriptures revealed before me, and I give you the good news of the messenger after me. His name is Ahmad." But when that messenger arrived with clear proofs, they said, "This is a clever deception
Who could be more evil than the one inventing lies about Allah, even though what he is being invited towards is (nothing but) peace! And Allah does not guide the nation of evildoers
They want to put out the light of Allah by blowing on it with their mouth. But Allah is going to complete His light _ (the guidance) _ much to the chagrin of the disbelievers
It is He Who sent His messenger with the guidance and the true religion, in order that it may prevail and triumph over all (fake) religions, much to the dislike of the idolaters
Oh you who believe! Shall I point out to you a trade that will save you from a painful punishment
Believe in Allah and His messenger, and strive in the path of Allah with your wealth and your lives. This is (certainly) better for you, if you only knew

He will forgive your sins, and usher you into the paradise, right through which run the rivers. (And He will admit you) into the excellent abodes in the eternal paradise of Eden. That is really the greatest triumph
As for that other thing you love, _ Allah´s help and victory in the near future _ give the believers the good news (of that victory)

Oh you who believe! Become the helper of Allah, like the disciples of Jesus, the son of Mary. He asked his disciples, "Who will help me for (the sake of) Allah?" They replied, "We are the helpers of Allah!" A group of the Israelites believed him, and another group rejected. Then, We assisted the believers against their enemies, so the believers prevailed
Everything in the heavens and on earth chants His praises! (He is) the King, the Holy, the Almighty and the Wisest

He it is, Who raised in an unlettered nation a messenger in their midst, the one who recites to them His verses, cleanses and purifies them, and teaches them the book and the wisdom. Prior to that, they were clearly lost and astray
(Muhammad, SAW is the messenger) also for others who have not yet joined the believers; and He (Allah) is the most Powerful and the Wisest
It is the blessing of Allah! He bestows it upon whom He wills. Allah is the Lord of the greatest honor

Those who were entrusted with the burden of the Torah but failed to bear its obligations, are actually like a jackass carrying a load of books. Worse (in fact) is the example of a nation who rejects the signs of Allah; and Allah does not guide the nation of evil doers
Say, "Oh you who became Jews, if you claim to be the friends of Allah, a people chosen (by Him) over all other nations, then wish for death if you are really truthful
They will never ever wish for death, because of what their own hands have wrought and sent forth. Allah knows the evil doers very well

Say, "Indeed, the death you flee from shall definitely come to you. Then, you would be presented before the One Who knows the unseen and the manifest; and He will tell you everything you have been doing
Oh you who believe! On Friday, when the call sounds for the (congregational) prayers, rush towards it and halt all trade (and business) activity. That is better for you, if you only knew
And spread out in the land. once the prayer concludes. Seek the bounties of Allah and remember Allah a lot, so that you would achieve success

When they see a bargain or an amusement troupe, they rush towards it and leave you standing. Say, "That, which is with Allah is better than any bargain or amusement. He is absolutely the very Best of all the providers

(Oh prophet), when the hypocrites come to you, they say, "We bear witness that you really are the messenger of Allah." Of course, Allah knows you are His messenger; (but) Allah affirms that the hypocrites are really the liars
They use their oaths as a pretext to dissuade (and deter others) from the path of Allah. What they do is indeed evil
This is so because they believed (at first), and then went back to disbelieving. (Now), their hearts have been sealed and they do not comprehend

(Oh prophet), the appearance of the hypocrites and their physiques are pleasing to look at. Their speech is so glib and pleasant, one likes to just keep on listening. It is as if they were carved out of wood and propped up (against the wall). They think (like cowards), that every call to action is against them. They are the enemies! Beware of them! May Allah curse them. How perverted are they
When it is said to them, "Come! The messenger of Allah will seek forgiveness for you", they turn their heads away. You find them looking away in arrogance (and disdain)
It makes no difference whether you seek forgiveness for them or not. Allah will never forgive them. Indeed Allah never guides the nation of evildoers

They are the ones who say, "Do not spend anything on the companions of Allah´s messenger. (Wait) till they desert him." (All) the treasures of the heavens and the earth belong to Allah. But the hypocrites do not understand

They (the hypocrites) say, "When we return to town, the one with respect and honor will expel the despised (and humbled)." The respect and honor belong (entirely) to Allah, His messenger, and the believers. But the hypocrites do not know
Oh those of you who believe! Do not let your wealth and your children divert you away from the remembrance of Allah. Anyone doing that would indeed be the loser

Spend (in charity), out of what We have granted you, lest death comes to any of you and (remorsefully) he says, "My Lord, if only you grant me an extension, (a little more time), I would give (my wealth in) charity; and I would be righteous
Allah never extends (the life) for anyone, past his time. Allah is well Aware of what you do
Everything in the heavens and on earth chants the praises of Allah. To him belongs the empire! To him belongs all praise (and all gratitude)! He has power over all things
It is He Who created you. (Yet), among you are those who deny (the truth); and some of you believe. Allah watches everything you do
He created the heavens and the earth (based) on the truth. He gave you form, the most excellent (the best possible) form; and towards Him is your journey back

He knows everything in the heavens and on earth. He knows what you conceal, and what you declare. He has full knowledge of everything _ (all the emotions, intentions and thoughts) _ that exists in the hearts
Have you not heard the tales of those who denied earlier? They tasted the evil consequences of their conduct. There is, (in addition), a painful punishment (in store) for them

Allah´s messengers came to them with clear proofs. Yet, they (denied and) said, "Will (fallible) humans guide us now?" They rejected and turned away. Allah (in His Own right) is Free from all needs, and is Worthy of all praise

The unbelievers claim they will never be brought back to life (for reckoning). Say, "Of course you will! My Lord will definitely raise you (back to life). Then, He will certainly tell you what you had done. That is (really) easy for Allah to do
Therefore, believe in Allah and His messenger; and the light (of revelation) which We have sent down. Allah is well Aware of what you do

The day of gathering _ that day when He will gather all of you together _ will be the day of loss and gain, (the day of reparation and redress of wrongful deeds). He (Allah) will remove (and cleanse) the shortcomings (and sins) of the one who believes in Allah, and does righteous acts. He will admit such a person into paradise to live forever; rivers run right through it. That is the greatest success
(While) those who disbelieve and deny Our signs, shall really be the companions of fire. They will live there forever! It is a despicable destination

Unless it is with the (will and) permission of Allah, no calamity can ever strike (anyone). Allah guides (and soothes) the heart of the one who believes in Him. Allah is well-Aware of every single thing
Obey Allah, and obey His messenger! (Bear this in mind) if you turn away, (that the responsibility) upon our messenger is (nothing more than) to convey the message clearly and plainly
Allah! There is no god except He! The believers should place their trust in Allah

Oh those of you who believe! Your enemies are (likely to be) among your spouses and your children. Beware of them! If you forego, forbear and forgive, (you will find that) Allah is indeed the most Forgiving and the most Merciful
In reality, your wealth and your children are a trial (for you). There exists with Allah, a tremendous tribute (at the end of the trial)

(Practice righteousness and restraint), and fear Allah as much as you can. Listen and obey, and give charity. It is for your own good. The successful ones are really those who escape the greed within their own selves

If you advance Allah a sincere loan, He will multiply it and return it to you twofold; and (in addition) He will grant you forgiveness. Allah is the most Forbearing; He appreciates (and rewards) gratitude
(He is) the Knower of the unseen and the manifest, the Almighty, the Wisest

Oh prophet, (and Oh you believers)! If you (must) divorce your women, divorce them for a (prescribed) period. Count the period (correctly). Fear Allah, your Lord, and do not _ unless they have committed a flagrantly immoral act _ expel your divorced women out of their homes. The women too should not leave their homes. These are the confines of Allah. Anyone overstepping the limits of Allah actually commits an outrage upon himself. You do not know! (During that period), Allah may well bring about something (to cause reconciliation between the husband and wife)

At the end of the (prescribed) period, either hold back your women (in wedlock) lawfully, according to the well-known (prescribed) manner, or make the divorce final in accordance with the well known (prescribed) way. Take two of your fair minded (and respected) men as your witnesses. (Oh witnesses)! Bear the witness truthfully for the sake of Allah! Those who believe in Allah, and the life-to-come, are hereby being asked to heed. Allah will provide a way out for the one who fears Him

And, He would grant the bounties (and provisions) from sources they had not expected (or even imagined). Allah is sufficient for anyone who places his trust in Him. (Always, and without an exception), Allah brings His decrees to destiny. Indeed, Allah it is Who has appointed the destiny for every single thing

(Remember), if you are in doubt about the ´iddat.´ of your women, _ either because they are past the age, or haven´t yet started to menstruate _ it lasts three months. The ´iddat´ for the pregnant women (is three months, or it) lasts till the termination of pregnancy. (iddat: the period after divorce during which a woman is forbidden to remarry). Allah (grants a leeway and) makes matters easy for the one who fears Him

This is the commandment of Allah; He has revealed it to you. Whoever fears Him (and practices righteousness and restraint), Allah will cleanse him of his sins (and rid him of his faults and flaws); and Allah will magnify his rewards

(During the period of ´iddat´) have the (divorced) women live where you live, as your resources allow. Do not abuse and mistreat them, in order to harass them. If they happen to be carrying (your) child, then spend and bear their expenses till they carry their pregnancies to term. If they are nursing (your child), then compensate them in a fair and equitable manner. Settle the issue (of compensation) between you and your (former) wives amicably. Should the matter (of compensation) be difficult (and hard to resolve), then any other woman may nurse the child

Let the well-to-do spend according to his means, and let the one with limited resources spend according to what Allah has granted him. Never does Allah obligate anyone in excess of what He has granted him. Allah may soon change the difficult circumstances into (leisure and) comfort

So many communities (in the past) have been insolent and arrogant towards the commandments of their Lord, and His messengers. So, very harshly We called them to account. We inflicted upon them a severe punishment
They tasted the evil consequences of their conduct. The final outcome of their conduct was (nothing but) sheer loss

For them, Allah has prepared the severest (most awful) punishment. So fear Allah, oh you endowed with reason and intellect; and (oh) those (of you) who believe! Allah has sent you a reminder (and an admonition)

A messenger recites for you the clear and unambiguous verses of Allah! So that he, (the messenger), may bring out of darkness into light, those who believe and act righteously. Allah will usher into paradise _ rivers run right through it _ anyone who believes in Him and performs righteous deeds. There, he will live forever and ever. (There), Allah has (kept in store) excellent (and everlasting) bounties for him

Allah has created the seven heavens. And the same goes for the earth! The commands (of Allah) prevail over all of them (constantly). So that you may know (for sure), that Allah is capable of doing everything; and that Allah has (full and unabridged) knowledge of every single thing
Oh prophet! Why did you, in order to please your wives, forbid yourself that which Allah has deemed lawful for you? Allah is all-Forgiving, the most Merciful
Allah has prescribed a procedure for you to expiate (and rescind) such oaths. Allah is your Patron; He is the most Knowledgeable, the Wisest

(Remember)! The prophet confided in one of his wives concerning a certain matter. When she divulged (the information) to another one (of his wives), Allah informed the prophet about it. The prophet told his wife a portion (of what Allah had informed him) and ignored the rest. When he told her about it, she asked, "Who told you about this?" He replied, "The One Who knows all and is the most Aware has told me

(Oh wives of the prophet), the two of you better turn to Allah and repent. Your hearts have wandered off the right path. But if you back each other against the prophet, then (beware)! Allah is certainly his friend! And so are the angel Gibraeel, and all the righteous believers. Besides that, all the angels are his supporters

In case the prophet divorces you all, his Lord would perhaps grant him other wives _ widows or maidens, in your place. They would be better than you, more obedient, believing, pious, penitent and fond of fasting

Oh you who believe, save yourselves and your families from the fire. Humans and stones are its fuel! Burly and rigidly fierce angels are (appointed as guards) over it. They do not disobey or disregard any of the commands of Allah. (Rather), they (diligently) carry out whatever they are commanded
Oh you unbelievers! Do not make excuses today. You are being punished only for what you have (actually) done (and nothing else)

Oh you believers! Turn to Allah in repentance, an earnest (and heartfelt) repentance. Allah, your Lord, may just rid you of your sins (and your faults and flaws); He will usher you into paradise, through which run the rivers. Allah will not let the prophet and those who believe in him, be humiliated on that day. The light (emanating from them) would run in front of, and to the right of them. They shall call out, "Our Lord, (please) complete for us our light, and forgive us. Indeed, You have power over all things
Oh prophet! Wage a relentless struggle against the unbelievers, and the hypocrites. Be stern against them (and do not yield). Hell shall be their abode! What an evil (despicable) destination

For the unbelievers, Allah cites the case of the wives of the prophets ´Nooh´ and ´Loot´. They were married to two of Our most honorable and righteous servants. But they betrayed their husbands, and so their husbands could not help them against Allah at all. Both of these women were ordered to enter the hellfire just like all the others who (deserved to enter hell, and) would live there for ever

And for the believers. Allah cites the example of the pharaoh´s wife. She said, "Lord, (please) build me a house in paradise under your (auspicious) care. Save me from the pharaoh and his (evil) deeds, and save me from (such) an unjust nation

(And the example of) Mary, a daughter Imran, who had (rigidly) guarded her chastity. We breathed Our spirit into her. Thus, she gave credence (and bore witness) to the words of her Lord and His scriptures. She was (truly) among the obedient ones
Blessed is the One Who holds in his hand the kingdom (of the heavens and the earth). He is capable of accomplishing everything
(Blessed is) the One Who created the death and life, so He may try and test you; which of you performs the better deeds. He is the most Powerful, and the most Kind

The One Who created seven tiers of heavens, one atop another! You do not find any disparity or disharmony in the creation of Rehman, (the most Merciful). Cast another look! Do you find any breach (in the heavens)
(Go ahead)! Look again and again. Your eyes would wear out, and your sight would (wander and) return to you, bewildered and in vain

We have embellished the heaven nearest to this world with (numerous) lamps (the stars). We have made this heaven (a means) to bombard the Shaitan with missiles, to drive them away. For them, We have prepared a punishment by the blazing fire
There exists a punishment of hell for those who refuse to believe in their Lord. Theirs is a despicable destination
As they are hurled into hell, they would hear it shriek and scream (in anger); it would boil over furiously, as it blazes
It would almost explode in its frenzied fury. As a fresh crop (of sinners) is flung into hell, its warden would ask, "(How did you end up here)? Hadn´t a warner come to you
They would reply, "Yes! A warner had indeed come to us, but (alas)! We rejected him and said: "Allah has revealed nothing! You have just (blundered and) slumped into a grave error
They would say, "Had we listened (attentively), or applied our mind, we would have escaped being the inmates of the blazing fire
Thus, they would confess their sins; damned are the inmates of the fiery flames
Forgiveness and a rich reward exists for those who fear their Lord, though they do not see Him
(Little does it matter whether you) whisper your words in secret, or shout them out aloud! He is indeed aware of everything, (every thought) that passes through the heart
Why would He not know? He is the Creator! He is the all-Knowing, well Aware of every subtle detail

He it is, Who subdued the earth for you (and made it a comfortable and controllable habitat). So move along its surface and eat the food provided by Him. But (remember), towards Him is your (revival and) resurrection
Are you unafraid that He, the One in heavens (Allah), will not let the earth swallow you? That it will not suddenly begin to rock (as in an earthquake)
Are you unafraid that He _the One in heaven, (Allah) _will not unleash a violent hurricane upon you? Then you would learn in a hurry how (true and terrible) was My warning
Of course, (most of) their predecessors had (also) refused to believe. So (observe), how (devastating) was My wrath (and punishment)

Do they not look at the birds above them? They flap and fold their wings (and fly)! No one but Rehman, (the Merciful), holds them up (in mid air). Indeed He is the One watching over every single thing
Do you have an army that can support you against the Merciful (Lord)? In fact, the unbelievers are just duped by a delusion
